conclusion: Analyzing shadow changes when light source moves to the back right, focusing on position and size.
Object A is a small cake or dessert with shadow A.
Object B is a small dark object with shadow B.
Object C is a medical bandage roll with shadow C.
Object D is a ring or circular object with shadow D.
Understanding shadow mechanics: shadows move opposite to light source and change size based on light angle.
Light source moving to back right from viewing perspective.
Shadow A will move to the front left and elongate due to extreme light angle.
Shadow B will move to the front left and elongate in that direction.
Shadow C will move to the front left and may become longer, showing more of its 3D structure.
Shadow D will move to the front left, become more oval-shaped, and elongate.
Objects closer to light source have more pronounced shadow movements.
Height of objects affects shadow change dramatically.
Ring (D) might cast complex shadow due to hollow center.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D move to front left and increase in length/size.
